thread.title: New Center appears to be site of Pistons' new practice facility
thread.title_full: New Center appears to be site of Pistons' new practice facility

author: Detroit Free Press
title: New Center appears to be site of Pistons' new practice facility
text:
New Center appears to be site of Pistons' new practice facility The Detroit Pistons’ appear to be moving to New Center. Post to Facebook New Center appears to be site of Pistons' new practice facility The Detroit Pistons’ appear to be moving to New Center.  //on.freep.com/2mdguZ0   4 To   New Center appears to be site of Pistons' new practice facility Vince Ellis , Detroit Free Press Published 7:52 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 | Updated 42 minutes ago Work continues on the construction of Little Caesars Arena in Detroit on Thursday, January 19, 2017. (Photo: Eric Seals, Detroit Free Press) 59 CONNECT 4 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Detroit Pistons’ appear to be moving to New Center. 
The Pistons and Henry Ford Health System have scheduled a 3 p.m. news conference Friday, and it’s expected the team will announce the new location of its corporate headquarters and practice facility. 
The news conference will be held at Gilmour Center at One Ford Place, three blocks from W. Grand Blvd. in the heart of New Center. 
The news comes after the Pistons announced in November their move to downtown starting next season. The Pistons will share Little Caesars Arena, which still is under construction, with the Detroit Red Wings. 
A memorandum agreement with the City of Detroit obligated the Pistons to relocate the rest of their franchise downtown. 
A second location immediately north of the arena was under consideration, but the New Center location apparently is more convenient. 
Detroit Mayor Mike Duggan, left, shakes hands with Detroit Pistons owner Tom Gores, right, as Chris Ilitch, Ilitch Holdings, President and CEO, center looks on at a news conference in Detroit, Tuesday, Nov. 22, 2016. The Pistons announced they will move downtown Detroit and begin playing at the new Little Caesars Arena, home of the Detroit Red Wings, starting next season. (AP Photo/Paul Sancya) (Photo: Paul Sancya, AP)
